data.title: Avoid The Docket
data.text:
The Docket used to serve an incredible cheese burger. Imagine my disappointment to go there for lunch and find that they only serve prepackaged food now. Being short on time, I tried the turkey and cheese.  Big mistake.  It was so dry it put the SAND in the word sandwich. Even the copious amounts of mustard and mayo I applied could not salvage it. 
On a positive note, the bag of chips and diet Pepsi were spot on. 

Sweeny

data.title: Deliciousness at it's max
data.text: This place is unique because you cut the flatbread with scissors. I had a pepperoni flat bread. Delicious!!! Best flatbread I've ever had in my life. You must go if you are bored, hungry, and want a flatbread.

data.title: Handy for Jury Duty
data.text: The Docket has a great location fronting Tucker Blvd., right next to the Civil Courts building. It is a very handy place for people on jury duty. The offerings were very limited, but the people who work there are responsible for the "very good" rating. On food alone, it would be "average." They were most gracious in telling customers over and over what they had that day, as the place is lacking in signage. It is located on the first floor of the St. Louis University Law School, and it is big, clean, bright, and has a great view of downtown. The prices are pretty good for downtown St. Louis, too. It's also good for tourists who are walking the downtown sights to come in and grab and coffee and snack. I thought is was a very nice oasis in downtown St. Louis.

data.title: Jury Duty
data.text: Great place when you have jury duty.  Usually have a special buffet style.  Great menu too.  I'm typing more because it says reviews have to be 100 characters

data.title: Good Pizza!!!!!!!!!!!!!
data.text: This is a very unique place. First of all, instead of a pizza cutter, you use cooking scissors, to cut the flatbread. And its a very good tasting restauraunt.

data.title: Under new management!
data.text: Someone else in my party chose this restaurant and I was apprehensive after I read some of the negative reviews online. I think it's a great lunch option and the fries were excellent. I was also very impressed by our server. If you've been in the past I would go back and give it another try.

data.title: Not for those in a hurry.
data.text: Service slow from beginning to end. Wait staff tries to be attentive and are very pleasant  but everything crawls out of kitchen.During busy lunchtimes don't expect to get out in less than an hour. Several tables just took food in box. Food Ok except fries way oversalted.

data.title: Excellent food/lousy service
data.text: Food was great - the pizza is top notch, but we had horrible service and waited 45 mins to get our check and then finish paying the bill.

data.title: Holding Court at the Docket
data.text:
The Docket is in the lobby of the new SLU Law School Building in downtown St Louis, next to the Courthouse. If you would like to dine where you can get a view of busy lawyers, judges and clerks conducting business and socializing, this is your place.

We ate lunch at The Docket twice recently. Both times it was nice enough to sit outside, affording the best view of courthouse goings and comings. One day we had soup and salad, and the ham and brie panini. Both dishes were prepared well and served promptly.

The second time my companion had pizza and I had the stromboli sandwich. There seemed to be a glitch that day in the orderly flow of orders. Several times the wrong order was brought to a nearby table. Our food arrived correctly. The pizza was served on a wooden plank with pizza shears and large containers of parmesan and red pepper. The stromboli had a generous dish of delicious marinara on the side. The service was a little on the slow side and we had to wait for our check-fix this please! Lunch needs to be reliably speedy.

We look forward to visiting again and trying dinner there. Great addition to the downtown scene.
